title: Creating a Cyber Volunteer Force: Strategy and Options

last_post.content:
I guarantee there will be at least one program you have never heard of in here 👇

We can't be everywhere all at once. That's why cyber volunteer programs, which leverage cyber experts at the regional level to help support local organizations with capacity building and incident response, are playing a key role in cyber defense.

But how many cyber volunteer programs are there really, and where and who do they serve?

Really excited to see this study from MWE that further develops this body of literature and highlights many amazing programs.

title: Six Centuries of Type & Printing (letterpress and ebook bundle)

last_post.content: Back in 2020, I published Six Centuries of Type & Printing, a concise book – 64 pages – that actually starts centuries before Gutenberg, with Chinese and Korea printing, and then digs into 1450 to 2020, covering ~600 years of technological advances. Set in hot-metal type (Monotype Bembo) in North Yorkshire, printed in London, and bound in Germany with a foil-stamped cover & slipcase, I still have copies available for shipping worldwide! https://glog.glennf.com/tiny-type-museum-time-capsule-and-more/six-centuries-letterpress (ebook edition available)

title: GitHub - typst/typst: A new markup-based typesetting system that is powerful and easy to learn.

last_post.content:
So #pandoc has support for #typst output (https://github.com/typst/typst) as of version 3.1.2 (https://github.com/jgm/pandoc/releases/tag/3.1.2).

As far as I can tell that means that the #RMarkdown / #QuartoPub to PDF pipeline will sooner or later be able to produce high-quality output on par with LaTeX but *without* actually needing a LaTeX installation (and a lot faster at that (and less bogged down by decades of stacked-upon code (and hopefully even include less arcane error messages))).

Color me intrigued.
